msgs.text: Bitcoin black hole #2. Love the symbolism
Lots of Bitcoin art on Etsy: https://www.etsy.com/market/bitcoin_art

I just got this from EBay. 2005 $10 Liberty Dollar 1oz .999 Fine Silver Round minted by Bernard von NotHaus. This was one of Satoshi's inspirations for creating Bitcoin! Satoshi attended a "hacker's conference" in 2005 where he began talking about ideas for Bitcoin
If you are buying bitcoin now, you are an early adopter.

just secured on these inferior chains is kind of a joke at best
I saw someone post that the above was a Bitcoin nft but I saw you could only pay for it in ETH...
yeah I'm not sure why more artists aren't using https://raretoshi.com/
I don't think the debate on this is over.
yeah liquid is kinda a shitcoin
Always interested to hear your thoughts though.
If anything has to serve as a reserve currency, why not bitcoin? is how I see it. So while it may not be bitcoin as such, it relies on bitcoin and that's interesting enough
There's a group here in Miami called BitBasel who's interested in minting NFTs on bitcoin
I can see the merits of people valuing art and nfts, I think it's the future of it. I'd rather have bitcoin, but NFT's secured by Bitcoin makes sense for those that are into it.
I'd love to hear more about that
I'm meeting with them tomorrow, hopefully I'll have something interesting to report. One of the fellows behind the group wants to sponsor bitcoin brunch.
Oh lovely, have a great time!
Thanks. I want to get artists to show up and present at bitcoin brunch on the sunday before and after BTC conference 2021
I'm really interested in this machine learning art called GAN, if NFT's can be minted on bitcoin I'd like to push them in that direction.
I retweet a lot of their stuff.

On another note, I follow a person on twitter who generates AI art. I think their's a fascinating potential for AI art, and perhaps moreso, AI generated NFT art
https://twitter.com/hannahjdotca
I don't understand GAN, but the first few lines I read about it had me thinking of this page
that's because that's what her page is
amazing synchronicity right now. I'm a little shaken
Yeah, I've been absolutely enchanted by it. Would you like more people to follow?
I've been quite taken with some of the works I've seen. I guess it would be good to see some other examples
her software has trouble with faces. it's kind of eerie and likewise fascinating
this is one of my favorites https://twitter.com/DMTFL_/status/1425938681030975491?s=20
but this artist is good too
Is there a simple way to explain how it works? or rather what it does?
I've been kinda looking into it, they use word prompts that go to work on making images, and the styles and then the artists pick the ones they think are the best. There are different effects
I'm still trying to learn more about it
Hannah specifies who's style it's in. I wonder if you can program it to any artist, and how hard that is. I'd love to play around with this
it seems like programming would be useful for this type of hobby
However I'm not all the way certain.
A few follow me, I wonder if I could DM them about not necessarily their techniques but how it works
more along the lines of, "this art wow"
NFTs and Ethereum are Segwit2x 2.0 aka üí©üí©
Liquid is a private currency based on BTC not a shitcoin
Not a personal attack; I think art is valuable, but RN it‚Äôs distracting from a much larger issue and conning newbies into buying ETH
I tell people to stay away personally
Now that the DeFi circus is dying out ETH needs a new circus to pump its internal economy (gas fees and liquidity interest) and keep the VCs buying
Yeah it's always a new narrative
or on a bunch of unsustainable üí©  platforms
Until we end fiat and force govs to create Bitcoin reserved currencies, all else is a distraction
Creating a billion dollar art industry is only benefiting insiders and does nothing to further the goals of Satoshi and the cypherpunks

Not to artists imo, and also people that have enough spending money to collect. I've seen stunning digital galleries and I tend to think it's the future of the art space but it needs to be on Bitcoin for that to be the case. You would want to have the security of bitcoin to secure the NFT. Idk that's how I currently see things. Willing to change my mind.
I think there's room in our revolution for both.
I will agree to disagree. Social media was the revolution for artists. This is just insiders pumping ETH at the moment IMO
I agree that people that are learning in the space should be encouraged to focus on bitcoin and the Bitcoin network

Well it is also happening on bitcoin, like Premitive was talking about earlier and raretoshi, I feel like there's something to it talking about the idea of it, not the craziness that's happening on ETH. That's just money laundering. I think there's room for NFT's as Artists have often struggled in the digital space for rights of there works. I hold no ill will just it's interesting to talk about these things!

I agree with the idea that artists should be able to monetize more easily . I do think that there will be great decentralized platforms for that in the future. I also think that when they can store their energy in Bitcoin they will have more time for their passions. Great chatting with ya!
we could all agree on this, but unless we can afford to fund people, they're going to go where they can make money
most artists choose other blockchains because of how easy it is for them to get started making money on them
haha I wish I could give out more. I'm still trying to figure out if I can deposit sats through this bot. Right now all I have a some from the $faucet which has been dry for weeks
Yeah that could be interesting. If you find a way lemme know.

So <@!713597340291825705> <@!301450830295334912> <@!881036914700976199> reading through your convo I'm still a little confused. Do NFTs on [Bitcoin specifically] exist right now? Or are some just funded/bought with BTC? What exactly is https://raretoshi.com/ ? Is raretoshi affiliated with Ethereum or Bitcoin? Personally, I do think NFTs as rare digital collectibles is an interesting idea. I do think there is value there. I don't like them on Ethereum, and I agree with some of your points that right now, it seems like they are a scheme heading towards a rug pull. I kind of view the ETH NFT space as a test net for Bitcoin NFTs (kind of like what Bitcoin does for development anyway, testing things on other chains). Thanks again for the convo, it was interesting to read through
My understanding of it is it's nfts built on the liquid sidechain
Raretoshi is the marketplace for it
but then there's an MIT-licensed open source project called LNFT
I'm still trying to learn more.

NFTs *on* bitcoin, not so much, but there are projects like Counterparty which use the bitcoin blockchain to create NFTs. Rare Pepes were launched with Counterparty in 2015. I don't know of any other NFT-blockchain projects earlier than that.
https://rare-pepe.com/
As far as I know, Counterparty invented NFTs on bitcoin, but maybe color coins were NFTs? I'm still working on my bitcoin history

I will have to scroll up and read what you guys been talking about. I‚Äôd like to say though, NFTs are huge and not going away. Sure they may simmer down and become a little less trendy but I think they have a future in the digital space. There is a lot of potential for NFTs for many reasons. Especially, virtual reality becomes perfected and we have an ‚Äúoasis‚Äù (ready player one reference) I recommend the book and movie to everyone in here. So, if we have this awesome virtual reality world NFTs basically will be hot items you‚Äôll be able to use in the virtual world. I‚Äôm excited to see what the future holds for NFTs. If BTC NFTs become a thing that would be awesome!
they are a thing. people just don't care
